intro: Ceropegia choanantha, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, tuberous roots and thick, fleshy leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, delicate flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Ceropegia choanantha is popular as a houseplant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care.
